title: Beyonder chooses Norway for its first large-scale battery venture. — Beyonder
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Forus, Rogaland, Norway.

Capacity:
- The planned full-scale factory will have up to 10 production lines, creating around 2,000 direct jobs.

Investment amounts:
- N/A

Project progress:
- Beyonder has established a small-scale production line and is now planning a step-by-step factory development, with the potential to create between 500-600 direct jobs initially and up to 2,000 direct jobs in the full-scale factory.

Project type:
- The project involves the development of a large-scale battery cell production facility.

Value chain stages:
- N/A

title: Beyonder selects Haugalandet, Norway for large-scale battery venture
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Haugaland Industry Park in Norway, specifically in the region of Haugalandet.

Capacity:
- The article does not provide specific information about the planned capacity of the project or the current operational capacity.

Investment amounts:
- The article does not specify the capital invested in the project or any announced planned investments. There is no mention of subsidies received.

Project progress:
- Beyonder has announced plans for large-scale battery production in Norway, with a small-scale production line already established in Forus, Rogaland. The decision to establish the large-scale factory in Norway marks a significant step forward for the project. The project is in the phase of scaling up the building of the factory, which is expected to create about 500 direct jobs in the industry region of Haugalandet, with a potential of employing approximately 2000 people as production scales up.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, as Beyonder is developing a new technology for sustainable battery cells and is in the process of scaling up the building of the factory.

title: Successful financing round prepares Beyonder for the next level — Beyonder
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Rogaland, Norway.

Capacity:
- The automatic pilot line will be established in 2021, and the company will open its first separate full-scale commercial production plant in a separate location in Rogaland in 2024. The planned capacity is not specified.

Investment amounts:
- Beyonder has completed a NOK 125M capital investment round. 25% of the capital provided came from current investors, and the remaining 75% is from new investors such as Arendals Fossekompani, DSD Investering, Equinor Ventures, and Must Invest.

Project progress:
- The company is in the process of establishing an automatic pilot line in 2021 and plans to open its first separate full-scale commercial production plant in Rogaland in 2024.

Project type:
- The project involves the establishment of a battery center with research & development, labs, and production testing. It will include an automatic pilot line and a full-scale commercial production plant.

Value chain stages:
- The article does not specify the specific value chain stages covered at the facility.

title: Pilot production of battery cells and supercapacitors — Beyonder
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Forus, Norway.

Capacity:
- N/A

Investment amounts:
- BEYONDER has received 4.9 million kroner in support from Innovation Norway’s environmental technology programme, and together with the Chinese partner and battery manufacturer United Green Technology, the total amount for the project has reached 19.8 million kroner.

Project progress:
- The project aims to develop an upscaled pilot production line for battery cells and supercapacitors, including small-scale production of BEYONDER’s own super-active carbon (SAC), electrodes made with SAC, and electrodes made with silicon. These components are to be implemented into battery cells for customers to test. The collaboration with United Green Technology will develop batteries for the wind and solar energy markets in Europe and China. The project is expected to accelerate BEYONDER towards the commercial phase.

Project type:
- The project is focused on developing an upscaled pilot production line for battery cells and supercapacitors.

Value chain stages:
- The project covers the stages of developing battery cells and supercapacitors, including small-scale production of super-active carbon (SAC), electrodes made with SAC, and electrodes made with silicon, which are to be implemented into battery cells for testing.

title: Equinor Ventures invests in Beyonder
notes:
Location: Stavanger, Norway

Capacity: Beyonder aims to achieve a production capacity of 1500 cells/day by 2022.

Investment amounts: Equinor Ventures has completed an investment in Beyonder, a technology company developing sustainable high-power battery cells. The specific amount of investment is not provided in the article.

Project progress: Beyonder was established in 2016 and has developed a prototype production line based on its proprietary technology. The company aims to achieve its targeted production capacity by 2022.

Project type: Beyonder is focused on developing the next generation of high-power battery cells, super capacitors, and lithium capacitors for industrial applications. It is not specified whether the project is a new build, expansion, or conversion.

Value chain stages: The article does not provide specific information about the value chain stages covered at the facility.
